org.ejml.ops
Class SpecializedOps

java.lang.Object
  org.ejml.ops.SpecializedOps

public class SpecializedOps
extends java.lang.Object

This contains less common or more specialized matrix operations.

Author:
Peter Abeles

SpecializedOps

public SpecializedOps()
Method Detail

createReflector

public static DenseMatrix64F createReflector(DenseMatrix64F u)

Creates a reflector from the provided vector.

Q = I - γ u uT
γ = 2/||u||2

In practice multHouseholder should be used for performance reasons since there is no need to calculate Q explicitly.

Parameters:
u - A vector. Not modified.
Returns:
An orthogonal reflector.

createReflector

public static DenseMatrix64F createReflector(DenseMatrix64F u,
                                             double gamma)

Creates a reflector from the provided vector and gamma.

Q = I - γ u uT

In practice multHouseholder should be used for performance reasons since there is no need to calculate Q explicitly.

Parameters:
u - A vector. Not modified.
gamma - To produce a reflector gamma needs to be equal to 2/||u||.
Returns:
An orthogonal reflector.

copyChangeRow

public static DenseMatrix64F copyChangeRow(int[] order,
                                           DenseMatrix64F src,
                                           DenseMatrix64F dst)
Creates a copy of a matrix but swaps the rows as specified by the order array.

Parameters:
order - Specifies which row in the dest corresponds to a row in the src. Not modified.
src - The original matrix. Not modified.
dst - A Matrix that is a row swapped copy of src. Modified.

diffNormF

public static double diffNormF(DenseMatrix64F a,
                               DenseMatrix64F b)

Computes the F norm of the difference between the two Matrices:

Sqrt{∑i=1:m ∑j=1:n ( aij - bij)2}

This is often used as a cost function.

Parameters:
a - m by n matrix. Not modified.
b - m by n matrix. Not modified.
Returns:
The F normal of the difference matrix.
See Also:
NormOps.fastNormF(org.ejml.data.DenseMatrix64F)

diffNormF_fast

public static double diffNormF_fast(DenseMatrix64F a,
                                    DenseMatrix64F b)

diffNormP1

public static double diffNormP1(DenseMatrix64F a,
                                DenseMatrix64F b)

Computes the p=1 p-norm of the difference between the two Matrices:

∑i=1:m ∑j=1:n | aij - bij|

where |x| is the absolute value of x.

This is often used as a cost function.

Parameters:
a - m by n matrix. Not modified.
b - m by n matrix. Not modified.
Returns:
The p=1 p-norm of the difference matrix.

addIdentity

public static void addIdentity(DenseMatrix64F A,
                               DenseMatrix64F B,
                               double alpha)

Performs the following operation:

B = A + αI

Parameters:
A - A square matrix. Not modified.
B - A square matrix that the results are saved to. Modified.
alpha - Scaling factor for the identity matrix.

submatrix

public static void submatrix(DenseMatrix64F orig,
                             int y0,
                             int y1,
                             int x0,
                             int x1,
                             DenseMatrix64F sub)

Sets 'sub' equal to the specified submatrix of 'orig'. Sub is reshaped if neccisary. The submatrix will contains columns x0 to x1 and rows y0 to y1, all inclusive.

si-y0 , j-x0 = oij for all y0 ≤ i ≤ y1 and x0 ≤ j ≤ x1

where 'sij' is an element in the submatrix and 'oij' is an element in the original matrix.

Parameters:
orig - The original matrix which is to be copied. Not modified.
x0 - Start column.
x1 - Stop column.
y0 - Start row.
y1 - Stop row.
sub - Where the submatrix are stored. Modified.

lu

public static LUDecomposition lu(DenseMatrix64F a)
Computes the Lower Upper (LU) decomposition of the matrix.

Parameters:
a - A matrix. Not modified.
Returns:
A new LUDecomposition if it worked, and null if it failed.

svd

public static SingularValueDecomposition svd(DenseMatrix64F a)
Computes the Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) of the matrix.

Parameters:
a - A matrix. Not modified.
Returns:
A new instance of SingularValueDecomposition or null if the decomposition failed.

qr

public static QRDecomposition qr(DenseMatrix64F a)
Computes the QR decomposition of the matrix.

Parameters:
a - A matrix. Not modified.
Returns:
QRDecomposition is returned if it worked, or null if it failed.

cholesky

public static CholeskyDecomposition cholesky(DenseMatrix64F a)
Computes the Cholesky decomposition of the matrix.

Parameters:
a - A matrix. Not modified.
Returns:
CholeskyDecomposition if it worked or null if it failed.

createSolver

public static LinearSolver createSolver(int numRows,
                                        int numCols)

Creates a linear solver that is appropriate for a matrix of the specified size.

Ax = b

Parameters:
numRows - number of rows in the A matrix.
numCols - number of columns in the A matrix.
Returns:
A linear solver.

subvector

public static void subvector(DenseMatrix64F A,
                             int rowA,
                             int colA,
                             int length,
                             boolean row,
                             int v0,
                             DenseMatrix64F v)

Extracts a row or column vector from matrix A. The first element in the matrix is at element (rowA,colA). The next 'length' elements are extracted along a row or column. The results are put into vector 'v' start at its element v0.

Parameters:
A - Matrix that the vector is being extracted from. Not modified.
rowA - Row of the first element that is extracted.
colA - Column of the first element that is extracted.
length - Length of the extracted vector.
row - If true a row vector is extracted, otherwise a column vector is extracted.
v0 - First element in 'v' where the results are extracted to.
v - Vector where the results are written to. Modified.

splitIntoVectors

public static DenseMatrix64F[] splitIntoVectors(DenseMatrix64F A,
                                                boolean column)
Takes a matrix and splits it into a set of row or column vectors.

Parameters:
A - original matrix.
column - If true then column vectors will be created.
Returns:
Set of vectors.
